sentence.Network_en: And then Captain Charles sings, "Don't ever laugh when a hearse goes by or you will be the next to die."
sentence.Network_cn: 随后查尔斯船长唱到：“如果你不想下一个死的是你，当灵车走过时绝不要笑。”

sentence.Network_en: The boy remained as dismal as a hearse.
sentence.Network_cn: 那孩子仍然看上去像口棺材,死气沉沉.

sentence.Network_en: It was a big black battered hearse -- like automobile . There were three men in it.
sentence.Network_cn: 那是一辆破旧不堪的黑色大车,活象一辆柩车. 车里坐着三个人.

derivation.yuyuan_name: middle English: from Anglo-Norman French herce 'harrow, frame', from Latin hirpex 'a kind of large rake', from Oscan hirpus 'wolf' (with reference to the teeth). The earliest recorded sense in English is 'latticework canopy placed over the coffin (whilst in church) of a distinguished person', but this probably arose from the late middle English sense 'triangular frame (shaped like the ancient harrow) for carrying candles at certain services'. The current sense dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.def: A hearse is a large car that carries the coffin at a funeral.

means.word_mean: 1. a vehicle for carrying a coffin to a church or a cemetery; formerly drawn by horses but now usually a motor vehicle

list.explanation: [铁路用语](挂在列车末端的) 货车守车
